detailed_profile.about: Experienced Partner leading KPMG services to the Commonwealth of Virginia, and Indiana. Having served as Chief of Staff to KPMG‚Äôs US CEO and Chairman, I am able to bring the depth and breadth of a Global firm to my state and local community. I am focused on delivering strategy and transformation initiatives, underpinned by a foundation of integrity and personal core values. I have developed a robust ecosystem of local delivery partners, inclusive of SWaMs and technology alliances, committed to achieving long term success. Mentoring colleagues early in their careers is important to me, so I actively lead the KPMG network of Women, a firm initiative helping our female professionals grow. When not spending time connecting with new folks, you will find me on our ‚Äúhobby farm‚Äù in Powhatan, in the garden, feeding the chickens and goats, or taking in the daily sunsets.

Advisory Insights enables KPMG's Advisory business to achieve greater market success by harnessing and elevating the firm’s strategic insights – and delivering quality content to clients with speed, impact, precision, and scale. We do this through:

- Growth topic leadership: Developing market strategy, positioning, thought leadership/insight plans, and activation approaches around key topics
- Insight generation: Developing market leading thought leadership and research assets and editorial content that effectively showcases leading insights
- Maximizing impact: Delivering insights to target audiences by equipping market-facing professionals and collaborating with marketing

recommendations: Jenny Brusgul ‚ÄúJeff and I worked together at KPMG in Advisory launching GTM campaigns, including content and insights. Jeff is one of the greatest leaders I've worked with - he is able to bring the best talents out of his team by empowering each individual to stretch his or her abilities and believe that the sky is the limit. Jeff is detail-oriented and rolls up his sleeves but he also can see the forest through the trees. Strategic thinking is a strong suit for Jeff and he also can execute well. Jeff always tries to bring a different perspective to every situation and challenge the status quo. A trait that I really admire about Jeff is that he is courageous and bold. He is not afraid to challenge leadership's thinking/ direction if he feels that it is not the right solution. Jeff will also go out of his way to speak up for his team and get the necessary resources needed to solve a problem. Lastly, Jeff has made an invaluable impact on my career and has helped me get to where I am today. Jeff, I will never forget your mentorship, guidance, and all the laughter we had together.‚Äù

Theshan Goble ‚ÄúJeff is an exceptional leader and a trusted advisor. He has an incredible ability to lead a team of experts that deliver cutting-edge content and insights that help clients navigate complex challenges and seize opportunities in the market. He is always looking for innovative ways to deliver value and impact to his clients and stakeholders. He is also a great mentor and coach who develops and empowers his people to achieve their full potential. He is a pleasure to work with and I highly recommend Jeff for any leadership role that requires strategic vision, operational excellence and people skills.‚Äù

detailed_profile.name: Jim Booth
detailed_profile.position: KPMG Advisory Managing Director focusing on the State & Local Government markets.
detailed_profile.about: At KPMG, serve as the Tech Pod Leader for State of Texas Account, leading our technical strategy across all our state of Texas agency engagements, and also leading the Microsoft Advisory Consulting Delivery focus for KPMG's State and Local Government (SLG) business segment nationwide. Over thirty years of delivering IT business solutions. Cross-discipline experience including full life cycle application and infrastructure system design and development, business process engineering, enterprise architecture strategic planning, integration of business process engineering with technical development, project management methodologies, and organizational change management. After starting at Coopers & Lybrand Consulting, Jim helped with a startup company called American Financial Network, and then moved on to senior leadership positions with BSG Consulting, Enron, USAA, and Catapult Systems before joining KPMG. At Catapult Systems has held several positions helping to lead business units in San Antonio, Austin, Houston, and then combined these into the Gulf Coast Region. Jim also started a new business unit in Washington DC focused our Federal business sector. In 2020, Jim transitioned his role to VP of Catapult‚Äôs National Practices, where he enjoyed growing the consulting services delivery strength across the country. Currently focused on growing KPMG's Advisory Consulting Delivery in the SLG business segment nationwide. Jim graduated from Texas A&M University College Station with a degree in Management Information Systems. He enjoys spending time with his wife and four children, and a wide range of outdoor sports and activities. My biggest joy in my job is helping my teams with coaching, mentoring, and strategizing how best to assist our clients, as well as learning from my teams daily as we strive to provide the best value possible. Technology consulting services is a team sport, and one I thrive on every day.

detailed_profile.name: Atif Zaim
detailed_profile.city: New York, New York, United States
detailed_profile.position: Deputy Chair and U.S. Managing Principal at KPMG US
detailed_profile.about: I am honored to serve as Deputy Chair and U.S. Managing Principal of KPMG US. Throughout over 30 years at KPMG, I‚Äôve been recognized for demonstrating excellence and innovation, leading and inspiring our people, living the firm's values, and collaborating across the U.S. firm and globally. I am passionate about solving big problems and listening to learn, and I enjoy working shoulder-to-shoulder with clients ‚Äì helping them think through their strategies to address their biggest opportunities and challenges. In my time at KPMG, I have served high-profile financial services clients in various leadership capacities. Previously, I served as U.S. Consulting Leader, leading the transformation of the business operations and people processes of KPMG‚Äôs Consulting Service Group, reducing friction and improving performance. Prior to that, I was the national managing principal of the Advisory practice, leading our team in developing and evolving the Advisory strategy, guiding the firm‚Äôs investment program and overseeing client and engagement risk. The pace of change today is staggering, and to me, leading is about inviting disruption before it‚Äôs forced upon us. In this role, my driving priority is positioning KPMG for the future and building something even stronger for the next generation.

detailed_profile.position: Vice Chair, Talent and Culture at KPMG * Passionate People Advocate * Champion for Workplace Culture and Experience * Future-Forward Talent Strategist
detailed_profile.about: In my current role as Vice Chair of Talent and Culture at KPMG US, I have the privilege of leading all aspects of our firm‚Äôs talent strategy, including positioning KPMG to attract, develop, and retain the best people. A member of the firm‚Äôs Management Committee, I work closely with KPMG‚Äôs leadership team to develop and implement initiatives that advance the firm‚Äôs growth strategy by unlocking the power of our more than 35,000 professionals and improving employee and partner experiences. Some of my key areas of focus include fostering a supportive, inclusive culture and work environment, developing future leaders and championing new ways of working that enable KPMG‚Äôs people to succeed and thrive in a hybrid work environment. detailed_profile.city: New York, New York, United States
detailed_profile.position: Technical Director, Advisory Data Organization at KPMG
detailed_profile.about: I am a Technical Director in KPMG‚Äôs Advisory Data Organization, specializing in enterprise data ecosystems and methodologies that enable data products. I am dedicated to enhancing the value of data through finding novel integrations of data, technology, and ways of working. I have guided the design, development, and use of enterprise scale data meshes and D&A operating models. My work emphasizes data democratization, trust in data, self-service experiences, data governance, and data management lifecycle optimization. I have also driven the development of data strategies, professional courses, and hosted seminars on data management and governance concepts for business and technical professionals.

recommendations: Johnny Strum ‚ÄúI had the best opportunities offered to me while working along side with Dallas. I owe thanks for a lot of my growth in a corporate setting to the determination and support that Dallas has tirelessly provided in my last 6 of 12 years here. I can honestly say that without him, I would not have pushed myself to be the leader I am today. Not many people in a position like his can take the time to cultivate another person to fit a role like mine, but I watched him do it over a dozen times with many others while working for/with him.‚Äù

detailed_profile.position: Associate Director, Experienced Hire Recruiting at KPMG - Deal Advisory
detailed_profile.about: Associate Director in KPMG Advisory's - Deal Advisory practice based out of the Pittsburgh, PA office. I recruit for positions on a national level leading the US talent acquisition efforts in the Accounting Advisory Services and Financial Due Diligence practice. Accounting Advisory Services: Our AAS team provides merger, acquisition, divestiture, accounting policy conversion and implementation, and other transactional support. Our team is experienced in providing advice on transactions that require complex technical accounting, tax, and financial reporting analysis. Our reputation is built on our dedication to quality service and technical excellence. We work together with our clients to help them understand the implications of complicated business and accounting decisions. Financial Due Diligence: As a Financial Due Diligence professional, you‚Äôll provide buy-side merger, acquisition, and divestiture support, focusing on stakeholder value by identifying key risks and benefits early in the transaction life cycle. This support includes pre-bid assessments; financial, tax, commercial, and information systems due diligence; as well as integration risk assessments, and accounting and tax transaction advisory services.

My role involves analysis of technologically-enabled processes in collaboration with clients, as well as overseeing the implementation of well-architected solutions while maintaining a high standard of project delivery.

experience.title: Senior Associate, Advisory
experience.description: ‚Ä¢ Architected multi-functional Agile technology transformations within large healthcare organizations, aiming to optimize experiences surrounding biomedical device management such as preventative and corrective maintenance, issue reporting for clinicians, and data migrations in computerized maintenance management systems.‚Ä¢ Conducted requirements gathering workshops for building internal products covering subjects such as customer service management, enterprise asset management, and field service management. Translated these customer requirements to technical specifications, and prioritized backlogs and sprints for developers. Managed first-level testing and debugging to ensure optimal client testing experiences.‚Ä¢ Managed large-scale data analysis and transformation during the migration of clients' ServiceNow workflows. Ensured accuracy and quality of data, and created and executed plans for deployment and cutover activities.‚Ä¢ Contributed to requests for proposals and quotes for KPMG Advisory projects. Responsibilities include presenting historical proofs-of-work, creating sample work agreements (SOWs), and designing proposed fee structures for potential engagements.
experience.description_html:
• Architected multi-functional Agile technology transformations within large healthcare organizations, aiming to optimize experiences surrounding biomedical device management such as preventative and corrective maintenance, issue reporting for clinicians, and data migrations in computerized maintenance management systems.

• Conducted requirements gathering workshops for building internal products covering subjects such as customer service management, enterprise asset management, and field service management. Translated these customer requirements to technical specifications, and prioritized backlogs and sprints for developers. Managed first-level testing and debugging to ensure optimal client testing experiences.

• Managed large-scale data analysis and transformation during the migration of clients' ServiceNow workflows. Ensured accuracy and quality of data, and created and executed plans for deployment and cutover activities.

• Contributed to requests for proposals and quotes for KPMG Advisory projects. Responsibilities include presenting historical proofs-of-work, creating sample work agreements (SOWs), and designing proposed fee structures for potential engagements.

detailed_profile.name: Bryan Thomas
detailed_profile.position: Senior Managing Director at KPMG Valuation (Tax)
detailed_profile.about: Bryan is a managing director in KPMG‚Äôs Financial Risk Management practice, has over 20 years of trading and risk management experience in the interest rates, foreign exchange, commodities and equities, with particular emphasis on derivatives. He assists banks, insurance companies, investment managers and non-financial corporations develop or enhance market and credit risk management as a core competency. Bryan‚Äôs risk management expertise includes designing, implementing and documenting risk limit structures and risk measurement systems (i.e., value-at-risk and stress testing), validation of in-house and vendor systems, and cultivating the ability to develop an appreciation for what the risk management system can overlook. Types of risk covered include interest rates, credit, equities, FX, and commodities for both cash and derivatives. Before joining KPMG, Bryan worked in the US, Paris, London, and Singapore for several international banks where he managed traders and engaged in market making, traded proprietarily, and developed foreign exchange and interest rate derivative new products and arbitrages. He trained customers and salespeople to use currency options for hedging, has been a frequent speaker at industry conferences on exotic options and risk. Specialties: Valuation of complex derivatives and hard-to-price securities, market risk management (measurement and governance), FAS 133 hedging

detailed_profile.name: Sanjay Sehgal
detailed_profile.about: Reinventing Finance for the Digital Age I am the head of markets for KPMG Advisory, and in that capacity, I lead KPMG industry, alliance, and go-to-market efforts. I work directly with CFOs of Fortune 500 companies across industries to help reinvent the finance function for the digital age and build the finance organization of the future. I help finance executives navigate new frontiers, supporting finance teams in making key changes to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their organization through process design and by leveraging emerging technologies such as AI, machine learning, robotics, and cloud solutions. My specialties include finance transformation, enterprise performance management, ERP, budgeting and forecasting, and strategic consulting. #CFOs #TheFutureofFinance #financetransformation #AI #ML #robotics #cloudsolutions #digitaltransformation #enterpriseperformancemanagement #ERP #budgeting #forecasting #strategicconsulting #consulting #strategyandvalue #ModernWorkforce #OrganizationalAgility #extremeautomation #DataAnalyticsandInsights #RiskandCompliance

I work directly with CFOs of Fortune 500 companies across industries to help reinvent the finance function for the digital age and build the finance organization of the future. I help finance executives navigate new frontiers, supporting finance teams in making key changes to improve the efficiency and effectiveness of their organization through process design and by leveraging emerging technologies such as AI, machine learning, robotics, and cloud solutions. detailed_profile.about: Chris is an experienced Infrastructure practitioner with 20 years' global experience in the industry. Based out of Vancouver, he leads KPMG's Infrastructure Transportation and Municipal practice in Western Canada, where he specializes in strategy development, capital planning, major project delivery, asset and operational management. At the forefront of innovation, he is a pioneer in the infrastructure innovation space, helping clients to think and act differently, navigating change and disruption, and setting them up for future success. Chris leads KPMG's Smart Cities Practice in Canada and is a driving force behind KPMG's Future Mobility 2030 initiative.

detailed_profile.position: Senior Associate Deal Advisory & Strategy at KPMG
detailed_profile.about: Maggie is a Senior Associate in the Deal Advisory and Strategy in the KPMG Advisory practice. She has executed several M&A transactions (integration, separation, carve-out) and is well versed in M&A due diligence (commercial due diligence, operational due diligence, financial due diligence). She focuses predominantly on the Consumer & Retail and Financial Services Industries, but has experience with Life Sciences, Industrial Manufacturing, and Automotive clients. Maggie graduated with honors from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign with a bachelor's degree in Accountancy and several distinctions, including Chancellor's Scholar, Gies Scholar, and James Scholar.

detailed_profile.about: As a Senior Technology Risk Consultant with various years of experience in the field, I'm passionate about helping businesses prepare for the future. I specialize in financial compliance, management reporting, and process improvement, leading projects that provide efficient business processes and deliver results. My expertise in risk management and technology allows me to identify potential vulnerabilities and develop solutions that mitigate those risks. I believe that the key to successful consulting is building strong relationships built on trust and transparency. That's why I approach every project with a collaborative mindset and work closely with clients to understand their unique needs and goals. When I'm not working, you can find me with my family and dog on a new adventure or on the golf course. I'm always looking for new opportunities to learn and grow, and I'm excited to connect with you. Feel free to connect with me if you'd like to chat or learn more about what I do!

detailed_profile.name: Christopher Eagar
detailed_profile.about: I will be graduating from the University of Miami in May of 2026. I am currently pursuing dual Bachelor of Science Degrees in Data Science & Artificial Intelligence and Business Technology, complemented by a minor in Mathematics. I am passionate about emerging technologies, specifically artificial intelligence, virtual and augmented reality, cloud computing, and IoT. At the University of Miami, I work as a Project Manager at the Virtual Experiences Simulation Lab (VESL), where I help lead 8 unique and innovative projects. I am also a founding member and active brother of Kappa Theta Pi, the university‚Äôs first-ever professional technology fraternity. Additionally, I am a member of Beta Gamma Sigma International Business Honor Society and Order of Omega Greek Leadership Honor Society. For summer 2025, I will be joining KPMG as an Advisory Intern in Technology. After graduating, I aim to leverage technology to address complex business challenges and drive data-driven decision-making.

detailed_profile.name: Madison Jakositz, CSM¬Æ
detailed_profile.position: KPMG Advisory Associate, State & Local Solutions
detailed_profile.about: I love working towards a purpose and goal - after earning my bachelor's degree from the Indiana University Kelley School of Business with majors in marketing, professional sales, and international business, I took my career into my own hands. I enjoy seeking out opportunities to better myself and gain new experiences. I have always set my standards high in work and in my personal life. I love being able to achieve things that I may be told I am not capable of. I am willing to take on any challenge / position necessary if it is what is best and needed. Pushing boundaries so I can improve and better myself is something I have always practiced. My minor in nonprofit management from O'Neill School of Public and Environmental Affairs at Indiana University - Bloomington displays my passion for service. I am always looking for opportunities to give back as this is a large value I hold. I am passionate about making a difference and strive to leave this world in a better state than I found it.

experience.title: Advisory Associate
experience.description: Consulting at KPMG has offered me many different roles and opportunities. Their value of lifelong learning through the development of their employees in all stages of life has aided in my professional growth. ‚Ä¢ Identified and managed risks, issues, and decisions to ensure project metrics were accurately being tracked which solidified a future path for project success ‚Ä¢ Facilitated communication and collaboration amongst clients and stakeholders to ensure clarity in timelines, progress, and changes creating strong relationships through building a solid foundation of trust‚Ä¢ Analyzed current state through on-site interviews and developed a future state recommendation to appropriately meet requested needs showing dedication and awareness
experience.description_html:
Consulting at KPMG has offered me many different roles and opportunities. Their value of lifelong learning through the development of their employees in all stages of life has aided in my professional growth.

• Identified and managed risks, issues, and decisions to ensure project metrics were accurately being tracked which solidified a future path for project success

• Facilitated communication and collaboration amongst clients and stakeholders to ensure clarity in timelines, progress, and changes creating strong relationships through building a solid foundation of trust

• Analyzed current state through on-site interviews and developed a future state recommendation to appropriately meet requested needs showing dedication and awareness

experience.title: Advisory Intern - State & Local Solutions
experience.description: KPMG is one of the Big Four firms meaning they are one of the four largest professional service networks in the world. They have professional services in audit, tax, and advisory. ‚Ä¢	Analyzed data related to key decisions, risks, and issues to make well-prepared Excel spreadsheets that made it easier for associates and managers to access necessary data‚Ä¢	Networked throughout the company to gain knowledge and connections with employees from across the nation which taught me a lot about the different opportunities I have the chance to obtain as a potential new hire‚Ä¢	Scribed meeting minutes with detailed notes to relay to the client, vendor, and project manager which gives a helpful reminder of what information was discussed, what action items need to be completed, and who is responsible for certain tasks
experience.description_html:
KPMG is one of the Big Four firms meaning they are one of the four largest professional service networks in the world. They have professional services in audit, tax, and advisory.

• Analyzed data related to key decisions, risks, and issues to make well-prepared Excel spreadsheets that made it easier for associates and managers to access necessary data

• Networked throughout the company to gain knowledge and connections with employees from across the nation which taught me a lot about the different opportunities I have the chance to obtain as a potential new hire

• Scribed meeting minutes with detailed notes to relay to the client, vendor, and project manager which gives a helpful reminder of what information was discussed, what action items need to be completed, and who is responsible for certain tasks

experience.title: Fitness Specialist/Event Planner
experience.description: Chatham Hills is a country club that attracts members through its various features including a pool, bowling alley, workout center, golf, and restaurant.  The club also hosts large events and parties for guests of members to come and potentially join the club as well.‚Ä¢	Organized parties for members of the club by setting up decorations and serving their desired food and drink orders which gave caused revenue for the club's restaurant and event area which benefits the overall well-being of the club‚Ä¢	Facilitated communication between the managers of sections like maintenance, food, and golf which created positive relations when collaborating on food delivery and preparation for the events and parties hosted‚Ä¢	Communicated attentively on the phone and in person to fulfill the needs of members to ensure a positive experience and instill retention in the club‚Ä¢	Maintained good relations with coworkers to create a positive work atmosphere that encouraged total effort in everyday tasks
experience.description_html:
Chatham Hills is a country club that attracts members through its various features including a pool, bowling alley, workout center, golf, and restaurant. The club also hosts large events and parties for guests of members to come and potentially join the club as well.

• Organized parties for members of the club by setting up decorations and serving their desired food and drink orders which gave caused revenue for the club's restaurant and event area which benefits the overall well-being of the club

• Facilitated communication between the managers of sections like maintenance, food, and golf which created positive relations when collaborating on food delivery and preparation for the events and parties hosted

• Communicated attentively on the phone and in person to fulfill the needs of members to ensure a positive experience and instill retention in the club

• Maintained good relations with coworkers to create a positive work atmosphere that encouraged total effort in everyday tasks

experience.title: Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion
experience.description: Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Alpha Omicron Pi sorority is a position that contributes to our chapter's leadership by providing a supportive environment for all members.‚Ä¢	Commenced this position as it was the first year the position was at my house, so I had to learn how to run the director position to make it a well-known, effective council at the sorority ‚Ä¢	Developed and implemented engaging programs to promote cultural understanding and competency within the chapter‚Ä¢	Led a body project training to help women of the chapter accept and feel more confident in themselves, and this helped make our chapter closer through vulnerable moments
experience.description_html:
Director of Diversity, Equity, and Inclusion at Alpha Omicron Pi sorority is a position that contributes to our chapter's leadership by providing a supportive environment for all members.

• Commenced this position as it was the first year the position was at my house, so I had to learn how to run the director position to make it a well-known, effective council at the sorority

• Developed and implemented engaging programs to promote cultural understanding and competency within the chapter

• Led a body project training to help women of the chapter accept and feel more confident in themselves, and this helped make our chapter closer through vulnerable moments

experience.title: K201 Peer Tutor
experience.description: Being a peer tutor for the required K201 class at the Kelley School of Business gives other students the opportunity to gain additional help from those who have already taken the course and passed with an A.‚Ä¢	Mentored students on the best ways to study for exams to help them earn high grades on the midterm and final exams ‚Ä¢	Assisted the professor in answering any questions students may have had and then teaching the students about the topics regarding confusion which allowed the class to continue for others ‚Ä¢	Led individual breakout room meetings to assist students in completing assignments that were due for homework credit which helped them generate overall better grades in the class
experience.description_html:
Being a peer tutor for the required K201 class at the Kelley School of Business gives other students the opportunity to gain additional help from those who have already taken the course and passed with an A.

• Mentored students on the best ways to study for exams to help them earn high grades on the midterm and final exams

• Assisted the professor in answering any questions students may have had and then teaching the students about the topics regarding confusion which allowed the class to continue for others

• Led individual breakout room meetings to assist students in completing assignments that were due for homework credit which helped them generate overall better grades in the class

experience.title: Marketing/Alumni Affairs Committee Member
experience.description: Indiana University Student Foundation is a philanthropic organization that helps set up and run the Little 500 bicycle race which is an iconic event that occurs every May.  On top of that, IUSF also runs other activities and stays in close contact with dedicated alumni.‚Ä¢	Organized events with alumni who gave their personal stories while they were on the committee and this helped give job opportunities for members of the club after presentations since they were able to have conversations and ask questions about their career‚Ä¢	Conducted interviews with other students for the monthly newsletter which made committee members aware of upcoming, important dates and events‚Ä¢	Connected with a large variety of people with different personalities and worked together to accomplish a large goal like setting up an event for the entire organization which raised donations for a local food shelter
experience.description_html:
Indiana University Student Foundation is a philanthropic organization that helps set up and run the Little 500 bicycle race which is an iconic event that occurs every May. On top of that, IUSF also runs other activities and stays in close contact with dedicated alumni.

• Organized events with alumni who gave their personal stories while they were on the committee and this helped give job opportunities for members of the club after presentations since they were able to have conversations and ask questions about their career

• Conducted interviews with other students for the monthly newsletter which made committee members aware of upcoming, important dates and events

• Connected with a large variety of people with different personalities and worked together to accomplish a large goal like setting up an event for the entire organization which raised donations for a local food shelter

positions.subtitle: KPMG
positions.description: Promoted to current role after showing tremendous leadership and support to the the overall KPMG Advisory Practice along with my specific Advisory Expense Management Team.Taken lead role of the Advisory Expense Management team. This includes overseeing a team of both US onshore and International offshore team members to help client facing US KPMG Advisory professionals with all of their expense policy and budget related items.In charge of overseeing a queue of expense approval and expense policy requests for the entire Advisory Practice of around 13,000 professionals.Facilitate Advisory wide trainings on a variety of expense related topics to educate professionals and to help the firm cut down on costs.Conducted a monthly expense review during a very critical expense environment that has helped the firm save thousands of dollars.
positions.title: Manager- Advisory
positions.description_html:
Promoted to current role after showing tremendous leadership and support to the the overall KPMG Advisory Practice along with my specific Advisory Expense Management Team.

Taken lead role of the Advisory Expense Management team. This includes overseeing a team of both US onshore and International offshore team members to help client facing US KPMG Advisory professionals with all of their expense policy and budget related items.

In charge of overseeing a queue of expense approval and expense policy requests for the entire Advisory Practice of around 13,000 professionals.

Facilitate Advisory wide trainings on a variety of expense related topics to educate professionals and to help the firm cut down on costs.

Conducted a monthly expense review during a very critical expense environment that has helped the firm save thousands of dollars.

positions.subtitle: KPMG
positions.description: Moved to current role from serving just the Deal Advisory and Strategy group within KPMG (3,000 professionals) to an Advisory Practice wide role (13,000 professionals) for the newly formed Advisory Expense Management Team, due to the tremendous value and knowledge that I bring to the firm. For over a year was the only US on-shore professional in charge of overseeing a queue of expense approval and expense policy requests for the entire Advisory Practice of around 13,000 professionals. As the Advisory Expense Management Team grew to include both new hires from a US onshore and International offshore perspective, I helped train new team members and assist them with any questions they had in new roles. While the KPMG firm introduced a new Travel Approval process I became a valuable resource for how to navigate through any issues and have a smooth transition.

basic_info.search_snippet: Principal at KPMG Advisory ¬∑ Viktor is a Principal for KPMG's Securitization practice, a division within the firm's Deal Advisory & Strategy organization, ...

detailed_profile.name: Viktor Beletskiy
detailed_profile.about: Viktor is a Principal for KPMG‚Äôs Securitization practice, a division within the firm‚Äôs Deal Advisory & Strategy organization, with 30 years of industry experience. Viktor‚Äôs core focus is in providing financial, operational, and regulatory assistance to the GSE‚Äôs, large and middle-market mortgage and consumer lending originators, trust administrators, and securitization participants. More specifically, he focuses on business process redesign, operational risk, and control assessments as well as risk governance, monitoring, reporting, and remediation. Viktor also has an extensive background in the design, development, testing, and implementation of systems utilized the bond administration, payment verification and tax administration processes. Specialties: Single-Family Residential (SFR) Property Valuations, Real-estate Mortgage Investment Conduit (REMIC), Collateralized Debt Obligation (CDO), Regulation AB, Market Discount, Residual Analysis (NERDs).

experience.title: Principal
experience.description: Viktor has expertise in large program management and engagement execution, including operational diagnostics and mortgage banking operations such as loan servicing, securitization, compliance breaches, and efficiency and effectiveness opportunities.  His skills also extend to the implementation of process improvements and enhancements in these areas.Viktor led the development of several technology based initiatives including; - KPMG‚Äôs Servicing Testing Tool (STT) to enable the gap analysis of servicers‚Äô current environments against National Mortgage Settlement (NMS) standards.  The tool includes the NMS definitions and standards, incorporating over 300 individual required servicing standards and related questions that are necessary to test and report compliance with the 29 NMS Metrics.  - Development of Single-Family Residential Property Valuation tool.  Developed to provide newfound insights into marketability of each property including local market trends, which can help identify opportunities and risks effecting long-term value.- Developed and implemented the KPMG REMIC tax administration system, REMIC Residual Management System and CDO Tax Compliance System.Process Refinement and Automation of Processes- Responsible for overseeing the design, testing, implementation, and ongoing enhancements of KPMG‚Äôs Loan Modification and Winfast MBS reporting systems for two leading GSEs. - Oversees the design and development of systems that handle high-volume transaction processing for large portfolios of assets (automobile loans, student loans, REMIC residual holdings, REMIC regular class interests, etc.)- Specializes in the automation of the performance of data-intensive investor reporting calculations.Viktor acts as KPMG‚Äôs National Coordinator for all Regulation AB Investor Remittance Reporting matters.
experience.description_html:
Viktor has expertise in large program management and engagement execution, including operational diagnostics and mortgage banking operations such as loan servicing, securitization, compliance breaches, and efficiency and effectiveness opportunities. His skills also extend to the implementation of process improvements and enhancements in these areas.

Viktor led the development of several technology based initiatives including;

- KPMG’s Servicing Testing Tool (STT) to enable the gap analysis of servicers’ current environments against National Mortgage Settlement (NMS) standards. The tool includes the NMS definitions and standards, incorporating over 300 individual required servicing standards and related questions that are necessary to test and report compliance with the 29 NMS Metrics.

- Development of Single-Family Residential Property Valuation tool. Developed to provide newfound insights into marketability of each property including local market trends, which can help identify opportunities and risks effecting long-term value.

- Developed and implemented the KPMG REMIC tax administration system, REMIC Residual Management System and CDO Tax Compliance System.

Process Refinement and Automation of Processes

- Responsible for overseeing the design, testing, implementation, and ongoing enhancements of KPMG’s Loan Modification and Winfast MBS reporting systems for two leading GSEs.

- Oversees the design and development of systems that handle high-volume transaction processing for large portfolios of assets (automobile loans, student loans, REMIC residual holdings, REMIC regular class interests, etc.)

- Specializes in the automation of the performance of data-intensive investor reporting calculations.

Viktor acts as KPMG’s National Coordinator for all Regulation AB Investor Remittance Reporting matters.

detailed_profile.about: Aspiring and successful professional with broad health insurance industry knowledge. Adaptable, goal oriented, and personable with a passion for healthcare. Client-centric attitude that drives significant value for clients. Ryan is a health insurance payor/plan process subject matter professional for KPMG with end-to-end knowledge of core insurance operational and technical functions/systems ‚Äî with a concentration on Actuarial and Finance processes. He supports process improvement efforts with health plans across the nation including commercial and governmental health insurance markets and product offerings. Recent work experience includes healthcare reform related reviews (including Cost Sharing Reductions, Three R's, Policy Based Payments, and EDGE Servers), and identifying process improvement opportunities. Ryan has concentrated experience working with health insurance issuers across the nation on both business and technical subject areas relating to end-to-end operational functions - such as marketing, sales, product development, underwriting, operations (e.g., enrollment, billing, fulfillment), actuarial, financial reporting, as well as supporting IT infrastructure/operations. His consulting experience spans both actuarial proficiencies and business process improvement experience across the health insurance industry. Actuarial Exam Progress Passed Exam 1/P in May 2009 Passed Exam 2/FM in February 2010 Passed Exam 4/C in June 2011 Passed Exam 3-F/MFE in March 2013 Passed VEE Corporate Finance Exam in September 2013 Confirmed completion of VEEs in February 2016 Passed Exam MLC in April 2017 Progressing through the ASA Modules in March 2018 Specialties: Actuarial Science, Health Insurance, Health Care Reform, Risk Management, Statistics, Excel, Microsoft Office, Visual Basic, and Computer Repair Knowledge

experience.title: Actuarial Analyst
experience.description: The Coal Mine Compensation Rating Bureau (CMCRB) reviews all coal miner workers' compensation claims (namely, traumatic and occupational disease claims) for the state of Pennsylvania. Based on this data and coal mine payroll information, the CMCRB determines the expected indemnity payments to an insurer (i.e. loss cost) and summarize the information in an annual report to the insurance commissioner of Pennsylvania.Some of my responsibilities include--review all OD claims, summarize results for this year's filing, maintain the CMCRB's web page and maintaining database information.  After concluding data review, I have examined and recreated exhibits summarizing traumatic, federal OD and state OD frequencies and severities.
experience.description_html:
The Coal Mine Compensation Rating Bureau (CMCRB) reviews all coal miner workers' compensation claims (namely, traumatic and occupational disease claims) for the state of Pennsylvania. Based on this data and coal mine payroll information, the CMCRB determines the expected indemnity payments to an insurer (i.e. loss cost) and summarize the information in an annual report to the insurance commissioner of Pennsylvania.

Some of my responsibilities include--review all OD claims, summarize results for this year's filing, maintain the CMCRB's web page and maintaining database information. After concluding data review, I have examined and recreated exhibits summarizing traumatic, federal OD and state OD frequencies and severities.

positions.title: Advisory Manager - Internal Audit and Enterprise Risk
positions.description_html:
Internal Audit Assistance
•Managed national compliance reviews for a financial services company. Trained and supervised a team of 25+ staff through over 500 site reviews. Performed scoping of risk, reporting to the client, and data management from a new system.
•Oversaw risk-based internal audits for regulatory, operational and financial subject matter. Responsible for audit scoping; identifying key risks and controls; creating and executing the audit program; writing internal audit reports; developing corrective action plans; and communicating findings to Senior Management.
•Conducted enterprise risk assessments to aid in risk prioritization; strategy development; current and future state mapping; and internal audit plan development.
•Managed a new product development gap assessment related to collateralized loan obligations for an alternative investment company.

Sarbanes-Oxley Assistance
•Conducted SOX 404 readiness engagements for pre-IPO companies. Responsibilities included scoping and materiality assessment; leading walkthroughs; writing process narratives; creating flowcharts; and gap identification and analysis.
•Managed the project planning, scoping, execution and delivery of Sarbanes-Oxley 404 Assistance Services for international technology and life science companies. Primary responsibilities included project management; identifying key business process and IT controls; writing test scripts; testing of business process and IT controls; evaluation of identified deficiencies; and remediation assistance.
•Led teams through their initial SOX 404 documentation and testing for organizations in the technology and healthcare industries. Responsible for documentation updates; controls rationalization; testing and reviewing controls; and performing impact analysis for exceptions.

detailed_profile.position: Partner, Sales Enablement Leader at KPMG
detailed_profile.about: Matt is a partner in KPMG‚Äôs Advisory practice with more than 20 years of experience providing financial statement audit, information technology audit, and risk and control services. Matt has experience in financial statement audit, Service Organization Control (SOC) reports, GRC implementations, IT internal audit outsourcing, Sarbanes-Oxley assistance services, IT general control reviews, computer-assisted auditing techniques (CAATs), and system-based application control reviews. His engagement experience is focused in the financial services and software and services industries, but he also has experience in the defense, manufacturing, healthcare, insurance, and retail industries. Matt is a Certified Public Accountant and Certified Information Systems Auditor.

experience.title: Managing Director
experience.description: Serves as a member of KPMG‚Äôs Internal Audit, Risk and Compliance practice specializing in providing risk and control services to clients in several industries. Risk Management:ÔÉπ	Developed and executed an enterprise risk management program for a Fortune 1000 company. ÔÉπ	Directed the effort to build a comprehensive risk based audit plan responsive to the operational, financial, information technology, and compliance risks of the client.ÔÉπ	Internal Audit and Compliance:ÔÉπ	Coordinated a 404 advisory engagement for a $4 billion multinational Fortune 500 retail company, which totaled about 12,000 hours of SOX documentation and testing activities.  ÔÉπ	Lead and managed international process and business reviews in about 25 countries.ÔÉπ	Met regularly with the Audit Committees and provided information to assist in the discharge of their responsibilities.   ÔÉπ	Coordinated audit efforts with the client‚Äôs external auditors and with the client‚Äôs compliance and risk management/oversight functions. ÔÉπ	Performed assessments of IT outsourcing and vendor contracts to ensure compliance with contractual terms and service level agreements. ÔÉπ	Regarded as a ‚ÄúSubject Matter Professional ‚Äùon areas such as enterprise risk management, internal audit transformation, business, process and information technology controls. ÔÉπ	ÔÉπ	Conducted a series of contract compliance reviews for co-promotion, license/royalty and joint manufacturing contracts for a major pharmaceutical company.ÔÉπ	Advisory Office Leader:ÔÉπ	Served as the KPMG Stamford office Advisory Leader, whose responsibilities include the cultivation of key business, civic and charitable relationships in the Stamford market. experience.description_html:
Serves as a member of KPMG’s Internal Audit, Risk and Compliance practice specializing in providing risk and control services to clients in several industries.

Risk Management:
 Developed and executed an enterprise risk management program for a Fortune 1000 company.
 Directed the effort to build a comprehensive risk based audit plan responsive to the operational, financial, information technology, and compliance risks of the client.

Internal Audit and Compliance:
 Coordinated a 404 advisory engagement for a $4 billion multinational Fortune 500 retail company, which totaled about 12,000 hours of SOX documentation and testing activities.
 Lead and managed international process and business reviews in about 25 countries.
 Met regularly with the Audit Committees and provided information to assist in the discharge of their responsibilities.
 Coordinated audit efforts with the client’s external auditors and with the client’s compliance and risk management/oversight functions.
 Performed assessments of IT outsourcing and vendor contracts to ensure compliance with contractual terms and service level agreements.
 Regarded as a “Subject Matter Professional ”on areas such as enterprise risk management, internal audit transformation, business, process and information technology controls.
  Conducted a series of contract compliance reviews for co-promotion, license/royalty and joint manufacturing contracts for a major pharmaceutical company.

Advisory Office Leader:
 Served as the KPMG Stamford office Advisory Leader, whose responsibilities include the cultivation of key business, civic and charitable relationships in the Stamford market.
 Served as the lead client partner on several prominent accounts of the Stamford office


Other areas of focus included:‚Ä¢	Prepared Firmenich‚Äôs first information security risk assessment, which formulated the 2005 Information Security Audit Plan.‚Ä¢	Performed several general control audits of the company‚Äôs information systems and external service providers. ‚Ä¢	Selected for participation on the Firmenich Security Council, whose responsibilities include drafting and implementing company-wide information security policies and procedures.‚Ä¢	Established the ERP Quality Assurance team for Firmenich‚Äôs SAP implementation. experience.description_html:
Responsible for planning, coordinating and conducting financial and operational audits of the Company’s worldwide affiliates. Other areas of focus included:
• Prepared Firmenich’s first information security risk assessment, which formulated the 2005 Information Security Audit Plan.
• Performed several general control audits of the company’s information systems and external service providers.
• Selected for participation on the Firmenich Security Council, whose responsibilities include drafting and implementing company-wide information security policies and procedures.
• Established the ERP Quality Assurance team for Firmenich’s SAP implementation. The team’s responsibilities include:
 Provide proactive and actionable advice on relevant aspects of project management.
 Ensure that critical problems or issues are identified, escalated and resolved.
 Provide a full review of project risk including mitigation plans.
 Conduct a full functional and technical review of the SAP solution being designed and implemented.

experience.title: Global Audit Director
experience.description: Responsible for planning, coordinating and directing the global Internal Audit department consisting of 2 staff auditors and an outsourcing arrangement.  Primary responsibilities included:‚Ä¢	Ascertaining the proper accounting and safeguarding of company assets.‚Ä¢	Conducting independent appraisal activities within the company to ensure compliance to company policies and procedures.‚Ä¢	Measuring and evaluating the effectiveness of financial and operational internal control systems based on the COSO and COBIT risk assessment models.‚Ä¢	Communicating the results of audit activities including the annual audit plan to the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors. Other Internal Audit Projects:‚Ä¢	Re-established the Corporate Audit Department, which included the development of a Departmental Audit Charter, standard operating procedures and Audit Committee Charter.‚Ä¢	Appointed by executive management to the strategic optimization transition team as part of the Company‚Äôs worldwide reorganization strategy.‚Ä¢	Member of the International Asset Management Team, whose efforts resulted in a 50% reduction of European customer accounts receivables and inventory.‚Ä¢	Reviewed and evaluated year end financial reporting packages and public filings for accuracy and compliance with SEC rules and regulations and established corporate policy.‚Ä¢	Developed and implemented an enterprise-wide control self-assessment program, which included the development of an Internal Control Manual and related questionnaires.
experience.description_html:
Responsible for planning, coordinating and directing the global Internal Audit department consisting of 2 staff auditors and an outsourcing arrangement. Primary responsibilities included:
• Ascertaining the proper accounting and safeguarding of company assets.
• Conducting independent appraisal activities within the company to ensure compliance to company policies and procedures.
• Measuring and evaluating the effectiveness of financial and operational internal control systems based on the COSO and COBIT risk assessment models.
• Communicating the results of audit activities including the annual audit plan to the Audit Committee of the Board of Directors.

Other Internal Audit Projects:
• Re-established the Corporate Audit Department, which included the development of a Departmental Audit Charter, standard operating procedures and Audit Committee Charter.
• Appointed by executive management to the strategic optimization transition team as part of the Company’s worldwide reorganization strategy.
• Member of the International Asset Management Team, whose efforts resulted in a 50% reduction of European customer accounts receivables and inventory.
• Reviewed and evaluated year end financial reporting packages and public filings for accuracy and compliance with SEC rules and regulations and established corporate policy.
• Developed and implemented an enterprise-wide control self-assessment program, which included the development of an Internal Control Manual and related questionnaires.

basic_info.name: Viktor Beletskiy - Principal at KPMG Advisory
basic_info.search_snippet: Principal at KPMG Advisory ¬∑ Viktor is a Principal for KPMG's Securitization practice, a division within the firm's Deal Advisory & Strategy organization, ...

detailed_profile.name: Viktor Beletskiy
detailed_profile.about: Viktor is a Principal for KPMG‚Äôs Securitization practice, a division within the firm‚Äôs Deal Advisory & Strategy organization, with 30 years of industry experience. Viktor‚Äôs core focus is in providing financial, operational, and regulatory assistance to the GSE‚Äôs, large and middle-market mortgage and consumer lending originators, trust administrators, and securitization participants. More specifically, he focuses on business process redesign, operational risk, and control assessments as well as risk governance, monitoring, reporting, and remediation. Viktor also has an extensive background in the design, development, testing, and implementation of systems utilized the bond administration, payment verification and tax administration processes. Specialties: Single-Family Residential (SFR) Property Valuations, Real-estate Mortgage Investment Conduit (REMIC), Collateralized Debt Obligation (CDO), Regulation AB, Market Discount, Residual Analysis (NERDs).

experience.title: Principal
experience.description: Viktor has expertise in large program management and engagement execution, including operational diagnostics and mortgage banking operations such as loan servicing, securitization, compliance breaches, and efficiency and effectiveness opportunities.  His skills also extend to the implementation of process improvements and enhancements in these areas.Viktor led the development of several technology based initiatives including; - KPMG‚Äôs Servicing Testing Tool (STT) to enable the gap analysis of servicers‚Äô current environments against National Mortgage Settlement (NMS) standards.  The tool includes the NMS definitions and standards, incorporating over 300 individual required servicing standards and related questions that are necessary to test and report compliance with the 29 NMS Metrics.  - Development of Single-Family Residential Property Valuation tool.  Developed to provide newfound insights into marketability of each property including local market trends, which can help identify opportunities and risks effecting long-term value.- Developed and implemented the KPMG REMIC tax administration system, REMIC Residual Management System and CDO Tax Compliance System.Process Refinement and Automation of Processes- Responsible for overseeing the design, testing, implementation, and ongoing enhancements of KPMG‚Äôs Loan Modification and Winfast MBS reporting systems for two leading GSEs. - Oversees the design and development of systems that handle high-volume transaction processing for large portfolios of assets (automobile loans, student loans, REMIC residual holdings, REMIC regular class interests, etc.)- Specializes in the automation of the performance of data-intensive investor reporting calculations.Viktor acts as KPMG‚Äôs National Coordinator for all Regulation AB Investor Remittance Reporting matters.
experience.description_html:
Viktor has expertise in large program management and engagement execution, including operational diagnostics and mortgage banking operations such as loan servicing, securitization, compliance breaches, and efficiency and effectiveness opportunities. His skills also extend to the implementation of process improvements and enhancements in these areas.

Viktor led the development of several technology based initiatives including;

- KPMG’s Servicing Testing Tool (STT) to enable the gap analysis of servicers’ current environments against National Mortgage Settlement (NMS) standards. The tool includes the NMS definitions and standards, incorporating over 300 individual required servicing standards and related questions that are necessary to test and report compliance with the 29 NMS Metrics.

- Development of Single-Family Residential Property Valuation tool. Developed to provide newfound insights into marketability of each property including local market trends, which can help identify opportunities and risks effecting long-term value.

- Developed and implemented the KPMG REMIC tax administration system, REMIC Residual Management System and CDO Tax Compliance System.

Process Refinement and Automation of Processes

- Responsible for overseeing the design, testing, implementation, and ongoing enhancements of KPMG’s Loan Modification and Winfast MBS reporting systems for two leading GSEs.

- Oversees the design and development of systems that handle high-volume transaction processing for large portfolios of assets (automobile loans, student loans, REMIC residual holdings, REMIC regular class interests, etc.)

- Specializes in the automation of the performance of data-intensive investor reporting calculations.

Viktor acts as KPMG’s National Coordinator for all Regulation AB Investor Remittance Reporting matters.

detailed_profile.name: Mick Tamas
detailed_profile.about: Merger integration, contract & third-party risk, and sourcing & category management advisor to US and international clients. Former Director of Global Sourcing with 20 years management consulting and substantial procurement transformation experience. I bring global cross-industry expertise, with over 12 years in the power & utility sector, numerous consulting roles in healthcare & life sciences, as well as energy, food & beverage, software, financial services, aerospace, and automobile manufacturing. I have advised Procurement executives for numerous cost savings project, reorganizations, and post-merger integrations and separations. I‚Äôve developed & implemented sourcing & procurement policies and trained professionals globally in category management / sourcing, contract management, & CPM preparation. Earlier in my career, my views on supply chain and process innovation were published in respected journals. Additional areas of expertise include power & utility supply chain, procure-to-pay & sourcing policy, cost modeling/total cost of ownership, and change management.

detailed_profile.name: Maggie Hines, CPA
detailed_profile.city: New York, New York, United States
detailed_profile.position: Senior Associate Deal Advisory & Strategy at KPMG
detailed_profile.about: Maggie is a Senior Associate in the Deal Advisory and Strategy in the KPMG Advisory practice. She has executed several M&A transactions (integration, separation, carve-out) and is well versed in M&A due diligence (commercial due diligence, operational due diligence, financial due diligence). She focuses predominantly on the Consumer & Retail and Financial Services Industries, but has experience with Life Sciences, Industrial Manufacturing, and Automotive clients. Maggie graduated with honors from the University of Illinois Urbana-Champaign with a bachelor's degree in Accountancy and several distinctions, including Chancellor's Scholar, Gies Scholar, and James Scholar.

detailed_profile.name: Yvette Jones , CPA , CA
detailed_profile.about: A results-driven Chartered Accountant, Business Consultant and Strategic Account Executive, with almost 20 years experience in selling, designing and implementing solutions to help clients transform and modernize the finance function with the objective of finding cost savings and efficiencies, reducing risk and expediting the automation and digital journey. This is achieved through streamlining and optimizing processes and automation through systems such as ERP and related technologies, reporting and automation tools My experience extends to Finance and Performance Management Consulting, Shared Services, Cloud services and solutions, Managed Services and Business Process Outsourcing, Digital and Automation solutions - ERP and related IT technologies and automation tools such as RPA. I also have experience in developing growing strategic accounts and new business through solution sales consistently achieving sales and profit targets in complex solution-sales. Core Strengths: Finance Transformation / Performance Management & Balanced Scorecard) / Delivery and Programme Management / Solution Sales / Digitisation, Automation / Shared Services / Process, BPM re-engineering and optimisation/ ERP sales and Implementation / Cloud Solutions/ Business Process Outsourcing / Operating Model transformation /RFP/RFI preparation and management of vendor selection

experience.description: EOH is the largest systems integrator of enterprise applications & solutions across Consulting & Advisory, Application, Managed Services and Cloud, in Africa. EOH delivers solutions from Advisory to Applications, Data & Analytics, Compute & Platforms and Outsourcing, all in a new cloud and AI driven context. EOH designs and implements digital industrial solutions with an integrated approach to OT/ IT convergence and IoT automation. As a Strategic Account Executive, I partner with our strategic clients to help them design commercially and financially ‚Äúno-brainer solutions‚Äù to SOLVE their business problems,  working with a team of EOH experts and specialists who design, deliver and implement the EOH Suite of solutions and technology -  helping our clients transform their organisations to achieve cost savings, operational, efficiencies streamlining, digitising and automating processes and systems.In my dual role as Finance Business Consultant , we work with the CFO and Finance to optimise the Finance Function by  streamlining, digitizing, and automating processes and systems
experience.description_html:
EOH is the largest systems integrator of enterprise applications & solutions across Consulting & Advisory, Application, Managed Services and Cloud, in Africa.

EOH delivers solutions from Advisory to Applications, Data & Analytics, Compute & Platforms and Outsourcing, all in a new cloud and AI driven context. EOH designs and implements digital industrial solutions with an integrated approach to OT/ IT convergence and IoT automation.

As a Strategic Account Executive, I partner with our strategic clients to help them design commercially and financially “no-brainer solutions” to SOLVE their business problems, working with a team of EOH experts and specialists who design, deliver and implement the EOH Suite of solutions and technology - helping our clients transform their organisations to achieve cost savings, operational, efficiencies streamlining, digitising and automating processes and systems.

In my dual role as Finance Business Consultant , we work with the CFO and Finance to optimise the Finance Function by streamlining, digitizing, and automating processes and systems
